title: Looking for a GCF
text: Is there a greatest common factor? Enter the greatest common factor or $$0$$ if there isn't one.

title: Factoring Polynomials
text: Is this a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than $$3$$ terms? How many different terms are there in the parentheses?

title: Cubes
text: Since this is a binomial, is it a sum or difference of squares or cubes?
speech: Since this is a binomial, is it a sum or difference of squares or cubes?
pacedSpeech: Since this is a binomial, is it a sum or difference of squares or cubes?

title: Factoring More
text: Difference of cubes can be factored down further.
speech: Difference of cubes can be factored down further.

title: Formula
text: Remember: the formula for difference of cubes is, $$x^3-y^3=\left(x-y\right) \left(x^2+x y+y^2\right)$$
speech: Remember: the formula for difference of cubes is,  x cubed minus y cubed, is equal to parentheses x minus y,  times parentheses, x squared plus x y plus y squared
